title: Tissue tropism and transmission ecology predict virulence of human RNA viruses
text:
Tissue tropism should be a key consideration for future comparative and evolutionary modelling efforts
 We propose that future predictive studies and preparedness initiatives with respect to emerging diseases should carefully consider potential for human virulence
authors: Brierley, Liam; Pedersen, Amy B.; Woolhouse, Mark E. J.

title: Chikungunya Virus Fidelity Variants Exhibit Differential Attenuation and Population Diversity in Cell Culture and Adult Mice
text:
To assess the potential contribution of genetic diversification by antiviral host deaminases, we evaluated mutant spectra for evidence of mutational biases
 Phenotypic characterization of these mutations by reverse genetics is warranted to elucidate their fitness effects
 Fidelity variant viruses allow for manipulation of intrahost diversity and can be harnessed to study phenotypic effects of intrahost diversity
authors: Riemersma, Kasen K.; Steiner, Cody; Singapuri, Anil; Coffey, Lark L.

title: Unifying Viral Genetics and Human Transportation Data to Predict the Global Transmission Dynamics of Human Influenza H3N2
text:
Here we use a model-based approach to explicitly tests spatial epidemiological hypotheses by integrating empirical data on human movement patterns with viral genetic data
 In conclusion, our framework is applicable to different infectious diseases and provides new opportunities for explicitly testing how host behavior and ecology shapes the spatial distribution of pathogen genetic diversity
